body:
Comment 1: 
I don't think your suggested change conveys the right information.  Constants don't have
the type of their literal; they are untyped.  We don't want to use the word "type" here.

The spec already says "There are boolean constants, rune constants, integer constants,
floating-point constants, complex constants, and string constants" and "A constant value
is represented by a rune, integer, floating-point, imaginary, or string literal."  Later
in the same section the spec says that implementations may have restrictions on the
precision they use to represent integer and floating-point constants.

So in fact I think everything is fine, or, at least, that the spec is consistent.  But
please feel to disagree.
